intro: Cynoglossum suaveolens, commonly known as sweet betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland areas, preferring well-drained soil. It is often used in herbal medicine for its purported calming and soothing properties. Cynoglossum suaveolens is also a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
